Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Cadbury has entirely eliminated the use of the word "Easter" on the packaging of their chocolate candy products.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that Cadbury still mentions "Easter" on the back of their packaging.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or examples of Cadbury's packaging to support the assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the absence of the word "Easter" on the front of the packaging means it has been entirely eliminated, without considering the presence of the word on the back or other parts of the packaging.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the absence of the word "Easter" on the front of some packaging, such as marketing strategies or design choices.
